Discover Real Estate In Edmonton

Edmonton homes for sale are some of the most sought after real estate listings in the province. The thriving energy sector has delivered prosperity and opportunity that are unparalleled throughout the rest of the country. With the abundance of wealthy buyers in the market, the city and home developers have worked tirelessly to build innovative, modern homes and neighbourhoods that embrace the best urban planning practices and technology. These features unite to bring you an unequivocal living experience.

When searching homes for sale in Edmonton, you’re sure to find an array of homes, townhomes, and condos touching on all price points, from affordable to luxury and everywhere in between. Whether you’re in the market for a beautiful brand new condo in the heart of downtown, a quiet family-oriented community, or a mature home in an established neighbourhood, this city truly has it all.

Single-family homes in Edmonton average around the $425,000’s and condos average around the $255,000’s. Use our search tool above to find homes in any particular neighbourhood or price range to begin searching for your perfect home. Also, be sure to view our current condos and townhomes for sale; these residences are an ideal solution for busy lifestyles or first-time homebuyers.

Explore Edmonton's Lifestyle and Amenities

Edmonton was originally established along the North Saskatchewan River valley for its bounty of timber, wildlife, and water. As the city expanded, it grew around the valley and preserved it as the focal point of the region. Today, the river is one of the region's greatest natural features, running from southwest to northeast Edmonton, carving its way through the heart of the city and bringing with it a healthy greenbelt. These areas are home to many popular public spaces for picnicking, swimming, and ice skating, just to name a few.

Edmonton is more commonly renowned for its annual festivals and grand shopping destination, West Edmonton Mall. Each year, ethnic groups from around the city unite to showcase their cultural pride at one of the city’s prime cultural centres, in Sir Winston Churchill Square, at the Art Gallery of Alberta, or in West Edmonton Mall. Residents not only frequent the mall for one of Canada’s best shopping experiences, but also to take in a show, concert, or event at the mall’s ice rink and many stages.

The city is also home to some of Alberta’s best schools and universities, including the University of Alberta and the Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT), and MacEwan University.
